metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4715 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Yann Collet LZ4 before r119, when used on certain 32-bit platforms that allocate memory beyond 0x80000000, does not properly detect integer overflows, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted Literal Run, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-4611. It was discovered that LZ4 incorrectly handled integers. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
